doc.after: The Defence Forces are made up of the Army, Naval Service, Air Corps and Reserve Defence Force. It is small but well equipped, with almost 10,000 full-time military personnel.[62] Ireland is a neutral country,[63] and has "triple-lock" rules governing the participation of Irish troops in conflict zones, whereby approval must be given by the UN, the DÃ¡il and Government.[64] Daily deployments of the Defence Forces cover aid to civil power operations, protection and patrol of Irish territorial waters and EEZ by the Irish Naval Service, and UN, EU and PfP peace-keeping missions. By 1996, over 40,000 Irish service personnel had served in international UN peacekeeping missions.[65]
